items.title: KTMB Reduces Temporary Charge For Debit/Credit Card Payments To RM1
items.summary:
Keretapi Tanah Melayu Berhad (KTMB) has announced that the Temporary Holding Amount (temporary charge) for the use of debit or credit cards will be reduced to RM1, effective 1 September 2025. Since the introduction of cashless payments in November 2023, the temporary charge had been set at RM30. For the uninitiated, the Temporary Holding Amount […]

items.title: KLIA Begins Trial Run Of Vehicle Access Management System (VAMS)
items.summary:
Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) has commenced a trial run of its new Vehicle Access Management System (VAMS). The trial began yesterday (1 September) and will continue until 30 November 2025 for KLIA Terminal 1 at Level 5 (departure drop-off) and Level 3 (arrival pick-up). Meanwhile, Terminal 2 will start its trial run on 15 […]

items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Samsung that drops the brand’s latest 27-inch Odyssey OLED G8 (G81SF) 4K 240Hz gaming monitor down to $899.99 shipped. This Odyssey display debuted just a few months ago at $1,300, and Samsung’s current deal – also matched at Amazon – takes $400 off its regular price. It first dipped to $900 during Prime Day in July, and today’s offer marks the return of that price with a $400 discount. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this model to date, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

items.summary:
It’s been an exciting summer for LEGO, as we’ve seen massive waves of new building sets release over the last few months with regular unveilings of new sets happening in between. Following the 107 new releases we saw hit the scene last month, September is geared up to be a much smaller event, though one stacked with plenty of standouts that already have builders champing at the bits – with some already available to preorder too. Of course, there are four different Gift With Purchase rewards that will be popping up for Harry Potter and the recently revealed Pirates of the Caribbean sets. items.title: This value-packed 5-piece luggage set with hardside spinners and tote bags is priced from $150 for Labor Day
items.summary:
5-piece Coolife Hardside Spinner Luggage Set

Buy for $150 (Reg. $190)

What we love

Luggage can get pretty expensive, but this value-packed bundle includes a total of five pieces and clocks in at only $150. Both Sky Blue and Dark Green colorways are priced this low right now, but there are other styles on sale, but the markdowns aren’t quite as generous. I love that this set includes both hardside spinners and tote bags.

more…

items.title: Anker’s powerful, MacBook-ready 167.5W 3-port USB-C car charger hits $36 (Save 33%)
items.summary:
Anker 167.5W 3-Port USB-C Car Charger

Buy for $36 (Reg. $54)

What we love

On busy days commuting from one place to the next, it’s easy to find batteries running low on your devices. Thankfully, Anker and others have really leaned into very powerful car chargers like this. Here you’ll find a unit that can distribute up to 167.5W of power to three devices. This is dished out at up to 100W for it’s main USB-C port and the secondary Type-C output tops out at 45W. Finally, the USB-A port can reach 22.5W. Another perk is that Anker includes a USB-C cable to get you started.

more…

items.title: Enjoy fall evenings outdoors with East Oak’s 50,000 BTU patio heater down at $106.50 (Reg. $180)
items.summary:
East Oak 50,000 BTU Patio Heater

Buy for $106.50 (Reg. $180)

What we love

While we keep our eye out for deals on these sorts of things all the time, now is arguably one of the most convenient moments for patio heaters like this to go on sale. Not only will they help you keep warm, but will also add some lighting so you can enjoy a bit more of the evening outdoors. This unit is ready to crank out 50,000 BTUs of heat, which is powered by a propane tank that is hidden in its base.

items.title: Still live: Lenovo’s compact yet powerful Legion Tab Gen 3 Android tablet down at $399 all-time low
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Labor Day sale, Lenovo is offering its 2025 Legion Tab Gen 3 for $398.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code EXTRAFIVE during checkout to see the discounted price. The tablet debuted at $500 earlier this year, with its price jumping up to $550 shortly after launch. It is, however, available with a solid $151 discount at the moment, landing $19 below its previous low and our mention from earlier this month. This is the lowest price we’ve seen for this tablet outside of special EDU and professional offers. It stands out as one of the best Android tablets you can get in this price range, and you can learn more about it below.
